ResourceHeader.Description:
AKEBONO, also known as EXOS-D, satellite has undertaken studies of particle-acceleration processes in the auroral magnetosphere. The Radiation Monitor, RDM, on AKEBONO consists of the High energy Particle Monitor, HPM, and the monitor for Radiation effect on IC, RIC. RDM data files hosted on the Science Data Base, SDB, are summary files for the HPM data. HPM observes fluxes of electrons in three energy channels, protons in three energy channels, and alpha particles in one energy channel. The table below is adapted from text listed at the following UL: http://www.stp.isas.jaxa.jp/akebono/readme/readme.rdm.txt.
+-------------------------------------------+ | Channel | Particle | Energy Range | |---------|----------|----------------------| | E1 | electron | >2.5MeV | | E2 | electron | 0.95 MeV to 2.5 MeV | | E3 | electron | 0.3 MeV to 0.95 MeV | | P1 | proton | 29 MeV to 62 MeV | | P2 | proton | 15 MeV to 29 MeV | | P3 | proton | 6.3 MeV to 15 MeV | | AA | alpha | 16 MeV to 52 MeV | +-------------------------------------------+
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Data are free for scientific publications. If you have any questions or requests about the RDM data, please contact Tsugunobu Nagai at the Tokyo Institute of Technology. When you publish a paper, please inform Prof. Nagai of your publication. In any publications, the use of the AKEBONO/RDM data should be acknowledged, for example, as "The AKEBONO/RDM data were provided through DARTS at Institute of Space and Astronautical Science, JAXA."
